As someone who always thought video game logic doesn't make sense to me and I can't do puzzle games, this was really, really fun..! It all made sense, I didn't get completely stuck at any point and didn't have to look anything up on my single playthrough. Sharing the fun of puzzle-solving with a friend in co-op is even better. 5/5

yes buy now buy and play now I love it so buy play buy play now Now NOW!!!!!!!!!!!

First of all it's really tricky (Not the green tricky if anyone knows about him) and people might hate on the game for that. But for me it's the time you finally complete it that feels amazing :) Even when you search up the answers (I ONLY DID THAT ONCE) it still feels good :) AND don't forget the portals (SPOILER ALERT) at the beginning of the you don't have the portal gun witch makes it even more fun when you do get it. Portal 2 is very good.

It may seem like a simple puzzle game that will challenge you with a unique element that isn't seen in other games & whilst this is true what you really stay for is the humour of the games.

The humour in these games is carried by Stephen Merchant (Wheatley) & Ellen McLain (GLaDOS) who deliver fantastic lines brilliantly. These jokes will often take centre stage over the puzzles as you put those to the back of your mind while just listening to the small funny metal ball speak in an awful american accent to trick the omnipotent, evil AI.

I give it a 8/10.
Its a funny and fun to play with friends
Now you can break the laws of thermodynamics again; bring a friend or just make your own darn levels once ya've finished the main course!

Portal 2 stands the test of time as one of the best coop platformers. The PC version has several ease of use features that I don't think were available when I played the xbox version, such as pressing tab to see the other player's point of view.
